The first, slower part of the guitar solo is omitted in the shorter version of the song.

Guitarist Brian May sings lead on the bridge, with the usual lead vocalist Freddie Mercury providing background vocals. May had a few things to say about it (quote mirrored here):

Interesting, I wrote myself a bit in the middle. I can’t remember quite why that was, it’s a very sort of Pete Townshend thing to do, isn’t it? But it made a nice little kind of duet in the middle, a bit of spying between me and Freddie, and I know he enjoyed that.
I want it all, and I want it now
Apparently the song emerged from Brian May’s wife Anita Dobson doing this urgent request.
Adventure seeker on an empty street
He wants to have a thrilling adventure and enjoy life but theres nothing to do, he’s bored
I want it all (Hey, yeah), I want it all

“The actual title was a favorite phrase of Anita’s, a very ambitious girl: ‘I want it all, and I want it now ’… We were never able to perform this song live. ”


Brian May 2003
